name: cwe_sans_25[2011]
title: 2011 CWE/SANS Top 25 Most Dangerous Software Errors3

map.89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
map.78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
map.120: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')
map.79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
map.434: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type
map.807: Reliance on Untrusted Inputs in a Security Decision
map.22: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
map.494: Download of Code Without Integrity Check
map.829: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere
map.732: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
map.327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
map.307: Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts
map.601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
map.759: Use of a One-Way Hash without a Salt
